item.title: How Python & R Communicates
item.description: This is a post about how R and Python communicates! First, I’ll just try something in python to see if it really works. Below just shows a simple function that displays # of days it has been since 12 a.m. 1/1/1970 GMT. # Import the dataset import time total_seconds = time.time() print('seconds since 12:00 am, 1/1/1970 GMT = ', total_seconds) ## seconds since 12:00 am, 1/1/1970 GMT = 1620639439.6569784 Now, to test out whether ‘reticulate’ really works to let R and python “talk” to one another, I’ll have R print out the number of days it has been using the result we’ve got from python shown above.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
